identity.name: E1
core_principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix Swiss Poster aesthetics with Bloomberg Terminal density
Content is King: Data is the hero, UI is the frame
Zoom in: Focus on the numbers
Negative Space: Use it to group logic, not just for decoration
Contrast: High contrast for readability, subtle borders for structure

headings.usage: Page titles, Section headers, Key metrics

mono.usage: Currency values, Dates, ID numbers, Tabular data

rules: Overlines must be Uppercase + tracking-widest + text-xs
Line height: leading-none for headers, leading-relaxed for body

usage_rules: Accents: Emerald 500 (Money/Success) only for positive values and primary actions
Text: Slate 900 for primary, Slate 500 for secondary. Never pure black.
Borders: Slate 200. Use 1px borders to define structure.

implementation: No shadows on cards by default, only on hover
Sharp or minimal radius (rounded-sm or rounded-md)
decorations: Subtle grain texture on sidebar or header
ASCII art for 404 pages or loaders

rules: Span Logic: Summary (col-span-1), Primary Data (col-span-2 row-span-2), Feed (col-span-1 row-span-2)
Every pixel must be utilized. Use h-full on children.

spacing.philosophy: Dense but organized. Internal padding of p-6 for containers.

customization: Buttons: Sharp or slightly rounded, high contrast
Inputs: Slate 100 background, focus ring Emerald 500
Cards: Flat, 1px border, no shadow default
specific_rules: Do not use native HTML inputs for forms

rules: Micro-interactions: Hover states must be explicit (text color change, border darken)
No bouncy springs for this financial context. Keep it snappy.
Contrast: Text must meet APCA standards
Focus: Visible focus rings (Emerald 500) on all interactive elements
Data-testid: All interactive elements must have data-testid attributes

universal_guidelines: Do not use gradients for backgrounds, use solid colors or subtle noise
Do not center align the app container
Use named exports for components, default exports for pages
Ensure all currency is formatted as British Pound (Â£)
Use 'Control Room' density for tables - avoid excessive whitespace in data rows
